message: You should move this project to github it is a bigger community and people can open issue request and issue pull request
otherwise if people are interested in the project registering on bitbucket is 20 sec
or use hg-git, which is what I do
@Vasil i understand it was just an idea, but i like to use github as something i kinda use a portfolio and it is nice to have everything in one area
anyway, I understand people like github, that's why I make mirrors for my projects there, hg-git is awesome
@italiano40 yes, so does this guy https://github.com/LittleForker
Maybe I'll move it there. I don' think I'm going to get into hosting it here and then mirroring it there.
Is github so much more popular than bitbucket?
@adsworth glad to hear it, github is just a better choice :)
@italiano40 the Service Hook for commits and the wider spread convinved me. The code is now at https://github.com/adsworth/conveggie
Have you given it a try?
git diff is nonstaged against staged, I'd expect not commited against last commit. It takes getting used to...
@italiano40 although I still find git more confusing than mercurial.
@adsworth I think you can use mercurial on github idk much about mercurial, git is very powerful
yeah, there is a hg-git plugin developed by the github people. But if I'm gonna host it on github I might as well use git.
True I mean I used svn before git and I probably learned most of git in a week or two also you may want to find a git client that will help you a lot
